option.name: VM_PARAMETERS
option.value: -Xmx512m -Xms256m -XX:MaxPermSize=250m -ea

task.summary:
Gradle & library updates
- Updated compileSdkVersion, buildToolsVersion to the latest version. - Removed applicationId, buildTypes, and lintOptions from build.gradle. - Updated OkHttp library to latest version. (2.4.0) - Went back to using Chris Banes' version of mvn-push-gradle. - VERSION_NAME is now 1.2 (snapshot). Big changes are coming!

Request delay support
You can now set a specific amount of time before executing the loading request.

ignoreIfRunning support
You now have an option to ignore the current request if a similar request (with the same tag) is already running. This is useful for making sure a request is running without waiting or constantly checking up on it.

Rewrote CallbackHandler & support for safe callbacks
The CallbackHandler was initially written to provide clean code. However, it was just hiding it and eventually got too ugly. It's has now been rewritten to use reflection and thereby keeping things short and sweet.
Also, you now have the ability to safely handle callbacks (be it via singleton or per request). This is extremely useful in certain occasions but please do not overuse it as it may cause bugs without you knowing due to it catching them.

Parcelable CREATOR static variable
Added a static CREATOR variable for the Enclosure class. Android Studio wouldn't stop complaining without it.

.setSingleton() method to replace the others
Okay, I admit it. My previous Builder buildSingleton() and replaceSingleton() methods were complete crap. We now set it directly via a static setSingleton() method.

Store callbacks in weak references
As mentioned by issue #5

Specify new Proguard rule
Since the new CallbackHandler relies on reflection, we don't want to obfuscate it.

MESSAGE.value:
Gradle & library updates
- Updated compileSdkVersion, buildToolsVersion to the latest version. - Removed applicationId, buildTypes, and lintOptions from build.gradle. - Updated OkHttp library to latest version. (2.4.0) - Went back to using Chris Banes' version of mvn-push-gradle. - VERSION_NAME is now 1.2 (snapshot). Big changes are coming!

Request delay support
You can now set a specific amount of time before executing the loading request.

ignoreIfRunning support
You now have an option to ignore the current request if a similar request (with the same tag) is already running. This is useful for making sure a request is running without waiting or constantly checking up on it.

Rewrote CallbackHandler & support for safe callbacks
The CallbackHandler was initially written to provide clean code. However, it was just hiding it and eventually got too ugly. It's has now been rewritten to use reflection and thereby keeping things short and sweet.
Also, you now have the ability to safely handle callbacks (be it via singleton or per request). This is extremely useful in certain occasions but please do not overuse it as it may cause bugs without you knowing due to it catching them.

Parcelable CREATOR static variable
Added a static CREATOR variable for the Enclosure class. Android Studio wouldn't stop complaining without it.

.setSingleton() method to replace the others
Okay, I admit it. My previous Builder buildSingleton() and replaceSingleton() methods were complete crap. We now set it directly via a static setSingleton() method.

Store callbacks in weak references
As mentioned by issue #5

Specify new Proguard rule
Since the new CallbackHandler relies on reflection, we don't want to obfuscate it.

option.name: LAST_COMMIT_MESSAGE
option.value:
Specify new Proguard rule
Since the new CallbackHandler relies on reflection, we don't want to obfuscate it.
